frontmatter.title: Quantum scale biomimicry of low dimensional growth: An unusual complex amorphous precursor route to TiO2 band confinement by shape adaptive biopolymer-like flexibility for energy applications
categories: Atomistic Simulations and Design in Biology
frontmatter.description: Crystallization via an amorphous pathway is often preferred by biologically driven processes enabling living species to better regulate activation energies to crystal formation that are intrinsically linked to shape and size of dynamically evolving morphologies. Templated ordering of 3-dimensional space around amorphous embedded non-equilibrium phases at heterogeneous polymerâ”€metal interfaces signify important routes for the genesis of low-dimensional materials under stress-induced polymer confinement.
